etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Edward Dana (1849–1935), mineralogist and physicist. From Spanish sideronatrita, with alteration of the ending after -ite

definitions: A yellow iron mineral occurring in very arid regions, typically as masses of needle-shaped crystals.

notes.text: Sideronatrite is a hydrated basic sulphate of iron and sodium, Na₂Fe(OH)(SO₄)₂·3H₂O. Crystal system: orthorhombic.
